events.message:
Merge #9211: [0.12 branch] Backports

d609895 [Wallet] Bugfix: FRT: don't terminate when keypool is empty (Jonas Schnelli)
8dee97f [QA] add fundrawtransaction test on a locked wallet with empty keypool (Jonas Schnelli)
82e29e8 torcontrol: Explicitly request RSA1024 private key (Wladimir J. van der Laan)
cca151b Send tip change notification from invalidateblock (Russell Yanofsky)
ad99a79 [rpcwallet] Don't use floating point (MarcoFalke)

remove MainCleanup and NetCleanup from getting called twice

On Windows10 this is a problem.  It appears that Netcleanup
and Maincleanup get called on nodeshutdown but also when Qt
exits.  The nodeshutdown completes but then QT wants to finish
and makes the second calls which can't be competed because the node
is already shutdown. Now the process hangs and leaves a partial process
in the tasklist but it isn't obvious to the user because they
can re-start bitcoin-qt without any issues. They will only notice
it if you try to delete the debug.log or look at your tasklist.
Fix boost c++11 undefined symbol in boost::filesystem::copy_file, by not using copy_file

Set STRIP var to override automake strip program during make install-strip

This is useful when cross-compiling for archs other
than the one we currently used to build the binaries.
In the case of aarch64 and armhf we need to use
/aarch64-linux-strip and arm-linux-gnueabihf-strip
rather than the usual strip program to successfully
remove debug symbols from the binaries.

events.message:
Set STRIP var to override automake strip program during make install-strip

This is useful when cross-compiling for archs other
than the one we currently used to build the binaries.
In the case of aarch64 and armhf we need to use
/aarch64-linux-strip and arm-linux-gnueabihf-strip
rather than the usual strip program to successfully
remove debug symbols from the binaries.

events.message:
Update config.{guess,sub} for Berkeley DB 4.8.30

Use http://savannah.gnu.org/projects/config repo to
udpat config.{guess,sub}. This is needed if you need
to compile bdb for aarch64.
Add aarch64 build to Travis-ci

Merge pull request #193 from sickpig/fix/gitian-linux-arm

Fix gitian descriptor for linux and arm

Merge pull request #194 from sickpig/new/add-aarch64-to-travis

Add aarch64 to travis-ci
Take out namespace from thinblock.h

Merge pull request #191 from ptschip/12.1refactorxthin

Refactor thinblock code

Make it possible to create Deterministic bloom filters for thinblocks

This will prevent any false positives from happening when  unit
tests are run which then gives a failed test result when it
wasn't a true failure.

Add non-deterministic tests to thinblock_tests.cpp
Remove references to LONG_LONG_MAX

Subject coinbase spends to -limitfreerelay

Previously we were forwarding all coinbase spends however this may
not be desireable by some users that want/need to completely prevent all
traffic below a certain fee rate by setting their -limitfreerelay=0.

There is also a potential attack vector here which is prevented in that
some attacker could get a hold of coinbase coins and use them to create
large amounts of spam transactions which would then get around any
rate limiting attempts by node operators.
rebase to latest core 0.12 branch

Merge pull request #195 from ptschip/12.1thintest

Use a hardcoded seed value for the bloom filter

Merge pull request #197 from ptschip/12.1coinbase

Subject coinbase spends to -limitfreerelay

do not allow HTTP timeouts to happen in excessive.py

We set the http keepalive timeout to zero to prevent a timeout from
happneing while we're waiting for a process to finish and then
we end up trying to request from a connection that no longer exists.
Instead we timout the connections right away so that each time a new
fresh connection is aquired.

This is something that has been coming up lately in very lately in long
running tests.

Only pass -lQt5PlatformSupport if >=Qt5.6

Conflicts:
	build-aux/m4/bitcoin_qt.m4

Use runtime linking of QT libdbus, use custom/temp. SDK URL

Conflicts:
	.travis.yml
	contrib/devtools/symbol-check.py

Merge pull request #196 from deadalnix/nolongmax

Remove references to LONG_LONG_MAX

Merge pull request #198 from ptschip/12.1brokenpipe

do not allow HTTP timeouts to happen in excessive.py

Merge pull request #199 from sickpig/fix/qt-gitian-windows

Fix qt gitian windows and linux

add netstyle for 'nol' network

fixes a coredump in bitcoin-qt when run with `-chain_nol`
Fix compiler warnings for leakybucket.h

Merge pull request #200 from ftrader-bitcoinunlimited/fix/missing_nol_netstyle_for_gui

fix a coredump in bitcoin-qt when run with `-chain_nol`

Merge pull request #201 from ptschip/12.1warnings

Fix compiler warnings in leakybucket.h

qt: Fix out-of-tree GUI builds

Without this patch:

- When I compile the GUI from the bitcoin directory itself, it works as
  expected.

- When I build the GUI in an out-of-tree build, I cannot get it to
  select tabs. When I click, say the "Receive" tab nothing happens,
  the button selects but it doesn't switch the page. The rest - even
  the debug window - seems to work.

See full discussion here:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7911#issuecomment-212413442

This turned out to be caused by a mismatch in the arguments to moc,
preventing it from finding `bitcoin-config.h`. Fix this by passing
`$(DEFAULT_INCLUDES)` to it, which gets set to the appropriate
path by autoconf itself.

qt: Fix out-of-tree GUI builds

Without this patch:

- When I compile the GUI from the bitcoin directory itself, it works as
  expected.

- When I build the GUI in an out-of-tree build, I cannot get it to
  select tabs. When I click, say the "Receive" tab nothing happens,
  the button selects but it doesn't switch the page. The rest - even
  the debug window - seems to work.

See full discussion here:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7911#issuecomment-212413442

This turned out to be caused by a mismatch in the arguments to moc,
preventing it from finding `bitcoin-config.h`. Fix this by passing
`$(DEFAULT_INCLUDES)` to it, which gets set to the appropriate
path by autoconf itself.

tree 4fb7556eb9ae69b94a9d3e6faef6c3f3e4b01d98
parent 2b56ea04ac824256b3631878d8f41712a5320d09
author Cory Fields <cory-nospam-@coryfields.com> 1465541802 -0400
committer Andrea Suisani <sickpig@gmail.com> 1483540102 +0100

build: add armhf/aarch64 gitian builds (partial cherry pick)

- update config.guess/config.sub for bdb for aarch64.
- temporarily disable symbol checks for arm/aarch64
- quit renaming to linux32/linux64 and use the host directly

This also adds a hack to work around an Ubuntu bug in the gcc-multilib package:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/gcc-defaults-armhf-cross/+bug/1347820

The problem is that gcc-multilib conflicts with the aarch toolchain.
gcc-multilib installs a symlink that points
/usr/include/asm -> /usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/asm.

Without this link, gcc -m32 can't find asm/errno.h (and others), since
/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu isn't in its default include path. But
/usr/include/i386-linux-gnu is (though it doesn't exist on disk).

So work around the problem by linking
/usr/include/i386-linux-gnu/asm -> /usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/asm.

The symlink fix is actually quite reasonable, but echoing the password into
sudo is nasty, and should probably be addressed in gitian itself. It makes more
sense to enable passwordless sudo for the build user by default.

This also adds a hack to work around an Ubuntu bug in the gcc-multilib package:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/gcc-defaults-armhf-cross/+bug/1347820

The problem is that gcc-multilib conflicts with the aarch toolchain.

events.message: Reanable zmq test on travis

Merge pull request #227 from ptschip/release_txperf

Release Branch - Fix txPerf.py for python3
Fix maxblocksinflight for python3

Comptool fix for the requestmanager re-request interval

When a block doesn't show up right away the request manager
will wait 5 seconds (on mainnet it is 30 seconds) before
re-requesting a block.  If that should happen during a test
we need to check whether the block was successfully re-requested
and if so mark the test as passed.  Previously we were waiting
for the 5 seconds but then returning with a False if the correct
block showed up when it should be True.

Comptool.py - replace missing leading zero from blockhash

When a blockhash begins with a zero, the zero will be missing when
calling block.sha256.  We need to replace those zero's before
doing our blockhash comparison.

Improve performance of bip68-112-113-p2p

We shave about 70 seconds of run time by taking out the sleep.
Since the comptool issue was resolved, we no longer need the
sleep.

Merge pull request #228 from sickpig/fix/reanable-zmq-test-on-travis

Reanable zmq test on travis

Merge pull request #229 from ptschip/release_bip9softforks

Release Branch - Comptool fix for the requestmanager re-request interval

Merge pull request #230 from ptschip/release_bip68

Release branch - improve perf of bip68 python test
change default AD higher to make it costly for a minority hash power to exceed it

Renable bip69-sequence.py

Most of this test runs just fine.  There is one test that
is commented out that requires RBF

Fix static bitcoin-qt build for x86_64-linux-gnu arch.

The actual "depends" machinery does not produce bitcoin-qt
while compiling static buids (i.e. `make -C depends
HOST=x86_64-linux-gnu). This is a temporary fix that let us
produce the gitian builds (who depends on the static build)
without wasting time. As soon as we have the release out
of the door we are going to commit a proper fix.

The problem is that Qt binaries (uic, lrelease, /qdbuscpp2xml and
qdbusxml2cpp) are installed under depends/x86_64-linux-gnu/bin
rather than depends/x86_64-linux-gnu/native/bin.

events.message:
Fix static bitcoin-qt build for x86_64-linux-gnu arch.

The actual "depends" machinery does not produce bitcoin-qt
while compiling static buids (i.e. `make -C depends
HOST=x86_64-linux-gnu). This is a temporary fix that let us
produce the gitian builds (who depends on the static build)
without wasting time. As soon as we have the release out
of the door we are going to commit a proper fix.

The problem is that Qt binaries (uic, lrelease, /qdbuscpp2xml and
qdbusxml2cpp) are installed under depends/x86_64-linux-gnu/bin
rather than depends/x86_64-linux-gnu/native/bin.

Ban node if PROCESS MESSAGESTART failure

Disconnect node using the disconnect flag

This prevents us from having locking issues.  Using the flag
ensures that we always disconnect nodes in one place and
with cs_vNodes properly locked.
Set a 4 hour ban only on Invalid MessageStart

Change the order of Network Initialization

Make Network initialization happen after the blockchain is loaded
and checked.  This prevents connection attempts from getting backed
and then executed all at once at the end of the startup, which can
result in a premature ban of a node or network crawler.

events.message: Add release not for version 1.0.1.1

This change affects the MaxGeneratedBlock, ExcessiveBlockSize & ExcessiveAcceptDepth qt text field widgets in the bitcoin unlimited settings dialog.

Before this change, the user could enter any junk text into these feilds and the dialog would accept that junk. When the user hit 'ok' then the settings would silently fail & the user would not be informed of the error or failure.

This change places QT integer validators on these text fields so that only a valid range of digits and integer value can be entered thus removing the 'silent fail' issue. This change also cleans up and simplifies the validation code for these fields. The changes are more consistant with the implementation of text fields elsewhere in the GUI (most of the other dialogs use QT Validators on textfields).

This change improves the user experience and removes the 'silent fail' that could happen when configuring these key fields.
Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/release' into release

early input checking for P2P messages
validate the result of every std container find() before using it, and avoid asserting if find fails
re-evaluate use of asserts

add locking in MarkBlockAsInFlight, rather than checking that the lock is already held.  convert a few asserts to debug mode only.  Change one use of a hardcoded number (coinbase comment size) to a symbolic constant
make DbgAssert log, some comment repositioning, remove dead code
fix indentation
back out unnecessary null check, fix one more spacing change
make debug assertion printout more helpful by printing the source file/line and add unit test

version 1.0.1.3

Centralized all validation for block size in one location in the code.
Fixed up poorly named local variables. Changed binary test logic to be consistant with the name of the function.
Reversed logic in code to make it more human readable. Minor variable name change to make it more consistant with the usage.
Added unit tests for emergent consesus validation functions.
Made the unit test clean up after itself so as to not interfere with other test cases.
Made the RPC code that sets the excessive block size actually use the universal validator.
Fix for issues with startup and mutiple monitors on windows.

Improved validation in bitcoin unlimited settings dialog
Remove #pragma once

Catch exceptions creating directory paths

Fixes #346

Disconnect and ban a node if they fail to provide the inital HEADERS

At the beginning of an initial sync it is possible for an attack node
to prevent the initial download of HEADERS required for the initial
sync to proceed. In the event that we do not receive the initial batch
of headers from a node then disconnect them safely with the fDisconnect
flag and then give them a 4 hour ban.

Merge pull request #419 from AllanDoensen/multiMonFix

Fix for issues with startup and mutliple monitors on windows.

Ensure that we connect to at least a few XTHIN capable nodes.

In the past we relied on -addnode or -connect-thinblock to manually
configure connection to XTHIN capable nodes,  or to just rely on luck
in getting a connection.  Here we will actively seek out XTHIN nodes
and maintain at least 4 connections or the minimum number of outbound
connections whichever is less.

Differentiate the different types of Outbound nodes

During the period where we are disconnecting outbound nodes
in search of XTHIN supporting nodes we don't want to inadvertantly
disconnect outbound nodes that we've manually configured with -addnode
, -connect or -connect-thinblock.  So we use a separate fAutoOutbound flag
to differentiate from from the general fNetworkNode connections.

Use defined values for max number disconnects and min xthin nodes

MAX_DISCONNECTS = max number of disconnects allowed while searching for
xthin nodes.
MIN_XTHIN_NODES = min number of xthin nodes to connect.

Do not disconnect nodes during IBD

When searching for XTHIN capable nodes it is not necessary nor desireable
to disconect nodes during IBD for two reasons.  One is that XTHIN's can
not be downloaded anyway during IBD but more importantly, disconnecting
nodes can cause block download timeouts, therefore we don't want to
actively disconnect a node that may have already requested blocks to
download which can then unecessarily distrupt the IBD process.

When searching for XTHIN capable nodes, check whether IBD is complete.

During IBD we do not check and search for XTHIN capable nodes
however by the time IBD is completed all the outgoing connections are
already in use and the netcode is blocked waiting for a semaphore grant.
Therefore we need to use a try_wai() on the semaphore and then checked
every so often whether IBD is complete and if so then begin the search
for XTHIN nodes.

Make the MIN_XTHIN_NODES configurable.

using -min-xthin-nodes one can set the number of automatically
connected xthin nodes rather than only using the default of 4.
Add a CTweak() for min-xthin-nodes
fix formatting

Add exploit_tests.cpp

This new test is a catch all to test for any exploit type testing.

-Also move the p2p message exploit tests from thinblock_tests.cpp to
this test file.

-Make receive queues and ip addresses reuseable in exploit_tests.cpp

-Add tests for block consistency checking

Consistency checks for blocks are handled fully in checkblock_tests.cpp.

-Also cleaned up the formatting and added some comments to block handling
in main.cpp

-Add transaction consistency checks

These are fully covered in transaction_tests.cpp and
AcceptToMempool()

Add consistency check for VERSION, VERACK, BUVERSION AND BUVERACK

 If we havn't sent a BUVERSION message then we must not receive
 a BUVERACK message.

 Add check for proper handshake for VERSION and VERACK messages
 If we don't get a VERACK before sending the VERSION then ban.

Add tests for INV consistency checks

Move the fSuccessfullyConnected to when the VERACK is received.

 Because we now have a proper handoff from VERSION to VERACK we can
 move the setting of fSuccessfullyConnected = true to the when the
 VERACK is received.

Ban node if improper nVersion is received.

 Previously the node was only disconnected however a bad actor
 may still try to reconnect several times.

Disconnect peer if VERACK not received within the timeout period

  Also get more aggressive with peers that do not give us a VERSION
  message.  Ban them right away if we don't get a VERSION as the first
  message.

Updated logging information for ERROR messages

  Print out more information for the VERSION , VERACK, BUVERSION and
  BUVERACK error messages.

Only allow XPEDITEDBLK processing if IsChainNearlySyncd()

  and also when !fImporting and !fReindex

Do not process thinblock messages if peer is not thinblock capable

Make sure the thinblock will connect

  Check the BlockIndex and make sure the previous block in the thinblock
  header has an entry in the Blockindex.  If not then give a small
  misbehavior.

Ban peer if we receive an unrequested block

  We should never receive a full Block that was unrequested
  except from a whitelisted peer. This is a definite misbehavior.

Give small DOS20 if get_xblocktx can not find blocks on disk

  The requester already knows
  that we have the block on disk or they would not have gotten
  and inv or header to begin with so this is definite
  misbehavior.

Fix for potential deadlock

We have to do the lock on cs_main outside of the section
where we lock mempool.cs.
Turn off thinblocks for txn_clone.py
check that the thin block has appropriate difficulty for the blockchain and other contextual checks
